New Records: Colin Rea has been great this year, with a 12-4 record and a 3.61 ERA. He has been effective in his last starts, giving up two or fewer runs in six of his games. Nick Martinez, with a 6-6 record and a 3.62 ERA, has also been a consistent performer. The Brewers are hitting well, with key players like Willy Adames, William Contreras, and Rhys Hoskins contributing significantly. The Reds have their own standout performers, including Spencer Steer and Elly De La Cruz, who have been impactful in their games this season.
Pre-Game Insights: The Brewers are projected to cover the spread due to their strong batting average and on-base percentage. The Reds, though struggling overall, have players like Ty France and Santiago Espinal who have been performing well recently. The Brewers have a good record when Colin Rea starts, and he has been effective against the Reds in his previous encounters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is part of an NL Central doubleheader, and it will be televised on BSWI/BSOH with a stream available on fuboTV. The Brewers are slight favorites with odds favoring them to cover the -1.5 run line and the over on total runs.
